com.github.shynixn.mccoroutine.bungeecord

Class MCCoroutineExceptionEvent

  • com.github.shynixn.mccoroutine.bungeecord.MCCoroutineExceptionEvent

  • public class MCCoroutineExceptionEvent

    A BungeeCord event which is called when an exception is raised in one of the coroutines managed by MCCoroutine. Cancelling this exception causes the error to not get logged and offers to possibility for custom logging.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MCCoroutineExceptionEvent(NonExistentClass plugin, java.lang.Throwable exception)
      A BungeeCord event which is called when an exception is raised in one of the coroutines managed by MCCoroutine. Cancelling this exception causes the error to not get logged and offers to possibility for custom logging.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Throwable getException()
      The exception to be logged.
      NonExistentClass getPlugin()
      Plugin causing the exception.
      boolean isCancelled()
      Gets if this event is cancelled.
      void setCancelled(boolean flag)
      Sets the event as cancelled or not. If the event is cancelled the exception is seen as an uncaught exception. Do only cancel this event if you want to log the exceptions on your own.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MCCoroutineExceptionEvent

        public MCCoroutineExceptionEvent(NonExistentClass plugin,
                                 java.lang.Throwable exception)

        A BungeeCord event which is called when an exception is raised in one of the coroutines managed by MCCoroutine. Cancelling this exception causes the error to not get logged and offers to possibility for custom logging.

        Parameters:
        plugin - Plugin causing the exception.
        exception - The exception to be logged.

    • Method Detail

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()

        Gets if this event is cancelled.

      • setCancelled

        public void setCancelled(boolean flag)

        Sets the event as cancelled or not. If the event is cancelled the exception is seen as an uncaught exception. Do only cancel this event if you want to log the exceptions on your own.

      • getPlugin

        public NonExistentClass getPlugin()

        Plugin causing the exception.

      • getException

        public java.lang.Throwable getException()

        The exception to be logged.
